str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To spend, bear expense, waste, squander. From dapane; to expend, i.e. to incur cost, or to waste.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.
A famine, hunger. Probably from leipo; a scarcity of food.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Feminine of a derivative of the base of chasma through the idea of empty expanse; room, i.e. A space of territory.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From husteros; to be later, i.e. to be inferior; generally, to fall short.
